text: Alice Mitchell Rivlin (March 4, 1931 - May 14, 2019) was an American economist. She was the U.S. Federal Reserve and budget official. She was Vice Chair of the Federal Reserve, Director of the White House Office of Management and Budget, and founding Director of the Congressional Budget Office. She was a senior fellow at the Brookings Institution and visiting professor at Georgetown University.
